title: Syria and Lebanon: The search for a fresh start since Assad's fall and Hezbollah's collapse
subhed: Beirut is seeking to build a relationship on equal footing with the new authorities in Damascus, but progress has remained slow. The weight of history, particularly Syria's tutelage over Lebanon from 1990 to 2005 and Hezbollah's involvement alongside the Assad regime from 2012 to 2024, has fueled mistrust.

title: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father released from ICE facility in Texas
French IT giant Capgemini to sell US subsidiary after row over ICE links
Frederik X, a monarch embraced by Greenlanders
subhed: Deeply attached to Greenland – where he once undertook a four-month expedition under extreme conditions – the king of Denmark is set to visit the island this month. Meanwhile, Donald Trump has not abandoned his ambition to claim it as American territory.

title: Two years after France introduced specialized units to combat domestic violence, results are mixed
subhed: The French Justice Ministry says most judicial and appeal courts have set up these units, which aim to provide a cross-disciplinary approach to handling domestic violence cases. On the ground, however, advocacy groups and lawyers remain cautious about the reform's impact.

title: Infantino, Trump's compliant underling in the lead-up to the 2026 World Cup
subhed: As the threats of the US president run counter to the universal spirit of the 2026 FIFA World Cup, FIFA's president stands out for his complicit apathy, writes Alexandre Lemarié for Le Monde.

Switzerland's ill-prepared army faces new global disorder
subhed: Despite maintaining military conscription and an extensive network of fortifications, the country remains under-equipped to address current threats such as missile or drone attacks.

title: Beehives, yachts and cattle: How France manages 'atypical' seized assets
subhed: As caseloads surge, France's asset recovery agency is grappling with an influx of unusual seizures, costly to store, tricky to sell and sometimes a legal maze.

title: Yuri Dmitriev, the Russian historian imprisoned for denouncing Kremlin attempts to rewrite history
subhed: Detained in a penal colony in Mordovia, the 70-year-old historian, who specializes in the Stalin regime's crimes, is one of Russia's oldest political prisoners. His crime? Refusing to accept historical falsifications that the Kremlin aims to impose on public opinion.
